comments:
build I20050413-0910

While looking at the console output for this build, I saw the following.
An InvalidRegistryObjectException should only be thrown when attempting to
access a configuration element that has been removed from the registry.
The decorator tests run after the dynamic UI tests, so it's possible that a
decorator was removed and the decorator manager was not updated accordingly.

This is correct behaviour anyways for a decorator that can't be updated. I'll
run the tests again and check for this.
Getting an NPE is expected behaviour?  Look at the last of the 3 stacks.

No - we are handling the error correctly is that I am saying. I'll see if I can
reproduce the exception

I'm going to remove the milestone as I haven't been able to replicate (perhaps
due to Bug 91591 as we are crapping out on shutdown) but I'll keep an eye on it.

I've added a null check in
LightweightDecoratorManager.LightweightRunnable.handleException to address the
NPE above, which I just saw again when running the tests normally (under debug).
 I think this could only happen if a null decorator was passed to the runnable's
constructor.  When this happens, handleException would log the problem, but then
would fail with the NPE.

Tod, when you run the tests on your machine, do you not see the console output
with the InvalidRegistryObjectException?  It doesn't cause any tests to fail,
but does appear in the console consistently for me.

The InvalidRegistryObjectException still appears in the builds.
See
http://fullmoon.ottawa.ibm.com/downloads/drops/I20050513-0010/testresults/consolelogs/win32_consolelog.txt

I can now get this running out of HEAD by adding a breakpoint to the
InvalidRegistryObject exception

The code

registryChangeEvent                             
.getExtensionDeltas(Persistence.PACKAGE_PREFIX,                                
       Persistence.PACKAGE_BASE);

Generates an exception during the action set tests. The testDecorators one is
another dynamic test.

The NPE in the decorator manager is fixed.
I haven't seen this in awhile.  Closing.
